Title: Memoirs of the Twentieth Century
Author: Samuel Madden
Description: A guardian angel travels to 1728 with letters from 1997 and '98

Title: Missing One's Coach: An Anachronism
Author: Anonymous Dublin University Magazine
Description: Traveler picked up by a stagecoach but is suddenly transported back over a thousand years.

Title: A Christmas Carol
Author: Charles Dickens
Description: Ghosts accompanies Scrooge into the past to show his life, then the future to show the consequences of his heartlessness if he does not change his ways.

Title: Paris Before Men
Author: Pierre Boitard
Description: Magic of a "lame demon" allows main character to interact with prehistoric life.

Title: The Clock That Went Backward
Author: Edward Page Mitchell
Description: A clock that has the power to take people back in time.

Title: El Anacronopete
Author: Enrique Gaspar y Rimbau
Description: First to introduce a time machine, originally written as a zarzuela in 1881, released as a novel in 1887.

Title: Looking Backward: 2000-1887
Author: Edward Bellamy
Description: Julian West towards the end of the 19th century, falls into a deep, hypnosis-induced sleep and wakes up 113 years later.

Title: A Dream of John Ball
Author: William Morris
Description: Describes a time travel encounter between the medieval and modern worlds.

Title: "The Chronic Argonauts"
Author: H. G. Wells
Description: Inventor takes another with him in a time machine, before deciding to leave to a time where he will fit in more.

Title: A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court
Author: Mark Twain
Description: 19th century citizen goes to King Arthur's time (528 AD).

Title: Tourmalin's Time Cheques
Author: Thomas A. Gutherie
Description: Time travel and the paradoxes that can result from it.

Title: Golf in the Year 2000
Author: J. McCullough
Description: A man falls asleep in 1892 and wakes up in the year 2000. Noted for its accurate predictions of the year 2000.

Title: The Time Machine
Author: H. G. Wells
Description: Inventor creates a time machine and travels to the year 802,701 A.D., where he finds humanity have evolved into two races, Morlocks and Eloi.

Title: Enoch Soames
Author: Max Beerbohm
Description: Enoch is transported 100 years into the future (1997) to see if he became a great writer or not – a Faustian-like pact with the Devil is involved.

Title: Armageddon 2419 A.D.
Author: Philip Francis Nowlan
Description: Anthony Rogers is transported to the year 2419 by a strange cave gas. Later became the comic strip Buck Rogers.

Title: Burnt Norton
Author: T. S. Eliot
Description: Begins with "Time present and time past// Are both perhaps present in time future..."

Title: A Traveller in Time
Author: Alison Uttley
Description: Child goes back into Derbyshire of the Babbington Plot and Mary Queen Of Scots.

Title: By His Bootstraps
Author: Robert A. Heinlein
Description: Circular paradox-character is brought to the future where he later operates a time machine to bring himself to the future

Title: All-Star Comics #10
Description: Justice Society of America use a time ray to travel 500 years into the future and get an effective bombing defence to protect America.

Title: Vintage Season
Author: "Lawrence O'Donnell" (joint pseudonym of C. L. Moore andHenry Kuttner
Description: Time travellers from the future experience wonderful seasons and spectacular events in the past.

Title: All-Star Comics #35
Description: Villain Per Degaton murders a scientist who has invented a time machine and tries to use it to change history, causing modern technology from the Present, meaning he can then conquer America with technology protected from the effects.

Title: Pebble in the Sky
Author: Isaac Asimov
Description: A retired tailor from the mid-20th Century is accidentally pitched forward into the future

Title: The Gauntlet[disambiguation needed]
Author: Ronald Welch
Description: After putting on a gauntlet, a boy finds himself transported back to Wales in 1326

Title: "A Sound of Thunder"
Author: Ray Bradbury
Description: Changes in the past affect the future; part of the genealogy of the term Butterfly effect

Title: Bring the Jubilee
Author: Ward Moore
Description: A time traveller from an alternate reality appears at the Battle of Gettysburg and alters his own future into ours.

Title: Experiment
Author: Fredric Brown
Description: An experiment involving the time travel of a small brass cube results in disaster.[1]

Title: The End of Eternity
Author: Isaac Asimov
Description: Use time machines to transfer goods between centuries

Title: "The Discovery of Morniel Mathaway"
Author: William Tenn
Description: Historian returns to mid-20th century to study artist whose works he finds himself having to create, so the past is a product of the future's interest in the past.

Title: Time Patrol, plus 10 others
Author: Poul Anderson
Description: Series of 11 novels related to the Time Patrol, an organization which protects the past.

Title: Extempore
Author: Damon Knight
Description: Man learns how to travel through time.

Title: Pawley's Peepholes
Author: John Wyndham
Description: Time travellers from the future disrupt life in a small town life by treating it as a quaint place for sightseeing.

Title: The Stars My Destination
Author: Alfred Bester
Description: In a future in which self-teleportation is common, Gully Foyle discovers how to teleport himself through time as well.

Title: Wythnos yng Nghymru Fydd (A Week in the Wales of the Future)
Author: Islwyn Ffowc Elis
Description: A novel in the Welsh language, in which the narrator travels to Wales on two occasions in the year 2033 and encounters contrasting future scenarios each time.

Title: The Door into Summer
Author: Robert A. Heinlein
Description: After thirty years trapped in suspended animation, a man uses a time machine to go back and exact revenge on his friend and fiancée for stealing his business.

Title: The Last Word
Author: Damon Knight
Description: Tale of Armageddon and the Devil.

Title: Soldier From Tomorrow
Author: Harlan Ellison
Description: A soldier comes back from the future to warn against the path toward global conflict.

Title: Double Indemnity
Author: Robert Sheckley
Description: Everett Barthold travels through time to find an ancestor lookalike who can be used to defraud an insurance company.

Title: The Men Who Murdered Mohammed
Author: Alfred Bester
Description: Comedy in which a professor travels back in time to kill someone by killing their grandparent, but the results confound him. Explores many time travel scenarios in a short story format.

Title: —All You Zombies—
Author: Robert A. Heinlein
Description: Circular paradox – the hero is both his own mother and his own father; in addition he manipulates his younger self using a time machine to make his own birth happen.

Title: The Day We Explored the Future
Author: Donald Keith
Description: Boy Scouts find an abandoned time machine and visit the year 4000 AD. (First of a 23-story Time Machine series appearing 1959–1989 in Boys' Life.)

Title: The Weirdstone of Brisingamen
Author: Alan Garner
Description: Colin and Susan go back in time in the caves of Alderley Edge in Cheshire – crystal bracelet, magic great wolf included.

Title: Danny Dunn, Time Traveler
Author: Raymond Abrashkin and Jay Williams
Description: A couple of teenagers use their professor's time machine to study the history of the US.

Title: Fantastic Four vol 1 No. 19
Author: Stan Lee and Jack Kirby
Description: The Fantastic Four travel to Ancient Egypt, and meet Pharaoh Rama-Tut, who is really another time traveller, from the 31st century. First appearance of Marvel Comics time-travelling villain Kang.

Title: The Other End of the Line
Author: Walter Tevis
Description: George Bletzo mistakenly call his own phone number and talks to his own person in a few months into the future. Predestination in play.

Title: Time Tunnel
Author: Murray Leinster
Description: Large immobile masses of iron in the earth's crust enable two-way travel between two points in the planet's history.

Title: Doctor Who
Author: various authors
Description: More than 530 original novels and novelisations based on the popular TV show.

Title: The Ship that Sailed the Time Stream
Author: G. C. Edmondson
Description: Ensign Joe Rate, "captain of a wooden ship in a predominantly atomic navy", is transported, with his ship and crew, first back to the time of the Vikings, then to the time of the Romans.

Title: The Green Bronze Mirror
Author: Lynne Ellison
Description: Teenage girl finds ancient mirror buried in sand, looks into it, is transported back in time to the Roman Empire – where she is mistaken for a runaway slave.

Title: The Man From When
Author: Dannie Plachta
Description: A man inadvertently destroys the world in order to travel back eighteen minutes in time.

Title: Hawksbill Station
Author: Robert Silverberg
Description: A time machine is used by an oppressive government for deporting political prisoners a billion years in the past, to the Pre-Cambrian era.

Title: Slaughterhouse-Five
Author: Kurt Vonnegut
Description: A man is randomly traveling through time in his life jumping from one event to another in no particular order.

Title: Up the Line
Author: Robert Silverberg
Description: Time travel as guided tours to past historical events.

Title: The House on the Strand
Author: Daphne du Maurier
Description: Drug-induced trip back to 14th century Cornish Village.

Title: Behold the Man
Author: Michael Moorcock
Description: A man travels in a time machine to 28 AD, hoping to meet the historical Jesus.

Title: Chronocules
Author: D. G. Compton
Description: A millionaire establishes a research village to experiment with time travel.

Title: Time and Again
Author: Jack Finney
Description: Uses hypnosis to travel through time.

Title: The Year of the Quiet Sun
Author: Wilson Tucker
Description: The government uses a forward-traveling time machine to survey the future and adjust its policies accordingly.

Title: Time's Last Gift
Author: Philip José Farmer
Description: Four scientists/anthropologists travel from 2070 A.D. to 12,000 B.C.

Title: Time Enough for Love
Author: Robert A. Heinlein
Description: Lazarus Long travels in time to 1916 and falls in love with his own mother.

Title: The Man Who Folded Himself
Author: David Gerrold
Description: Main character receives a belt that allows him to travel through time. Complications ensue.

Title: Crusade in Jeans
Author: Thea Beckman
Description: Rudolf Hefting is a fourteen year-old who volunteers for an experiment with a time machine. The experiment goes well, but he ends up accidentally stranded in the 13th century. He saves the life of Leonardo Fibonacci, without realizing who he is, and together they join the German Children's Crusade, where he aids the children and manages to save most of the children from horrible fates with the aid of his twentieth-century knowledge and a couple of items from the future (such as a box of matches).

Title: Bid Time Return
Author: Richard Matheson
Description: A young man sees an old photograph of a woman, and through hypnosis travels back in time from 1980 to 1912 to meet her. Basis of the 1980 film Somewhere in Time.

Title: "An Infinite Summer"
Author: Christopher Priest
Description: Time travelers from the future journey through the 20th century and use a device to "freeze" small groups of people into "tableaux" which they find interesting. The people in each tableau then become invisible and permeable to others, until the effect wears off, sometimes after many years.

Title: Time Storm
Author: Gordon R. Dickson
Description: A cosmic anomaly sweeps the Earth, subdividing the surface into irregular zones whose "present" is a randomly determined historical period of the past or future, which changes at irregular intervals. One man attempting to rescue his ex-wife accumulates a group of refugees from throughout history.

Title: Rotating Cylinders and the Possibility of Global Causality Violation
Author: Larry Niven
Description: A half-finished Tipler cylinder is discovered by a future human explorer. When the leader decides to complete it, his civilization is destroyed by a nova.

Title: "The Very Slow Time Machine"
Author: Ian Watson
Description: An enigmatic traveler from the future, in a time vessel which cannot be breached, baffles scientists in his past. (His messages include: "you must travel through time by an equal amount of accumulate hindward potential...")

Title: Time After Time
Author: Karl Alexander
Description: H. G. Wells builds a time machine, which is stolen by Jack the Ripper so he can escape the authorities and continue his killing spree in the future.

Title: Morlock Night
Author: K. W. Jeter
Description: What happened when H. G. Wells' time machine returned from the future.

Title: Closing the Timelid
Author: Orson Scott Card
Description: A man uses time travel to experience the sensation of death.

Title: Timescape
Author: Gregory Benford
Description: Use of tachyons to warn scientists of the past about an upcoming disaster.

Title: Thrice Upon a Time
Author: James P. Hogan
Description: Messages are sent back through time which deletes the timeline in which it exists.

Title: A Rebel in Time
Author: Harry Harrison
Description: Time machine misuse. U.S. Government aids the Confederacy with submachine guns.

Title: Kindred
Author: Octavia Butler
Description: Dana, an African American woman, is inexplicably transported from 1976 Los Angeles to early 19th century Maryland. She meets her ancestors: Rufus, a white slave holder, and Alice, an African-American woman who was born free but forced into slavery later in life.

Title: The Restaurant at the End of the Universe
Author: Douglas Adams
Description: Milliways is frozen in the last moment of the universe before it succumbs to final entropy, requiring time travel to reach it. Menu prices are astronomical, but patrons are advised to deposit a penny in a bank account now. By the time a patron reaches the final moment of history, compound interest will have transformed the penny into a fortune large enough to pay the bill.

Title: The Man Who Loved Morlocks
Author: David J. Lake
Description: H. G. Wells' time traveller confronts the Morlocks again, this time equipped with a camera and revolver.

Title: The Many-Colored Land, first book of the Saga of the Pliocene Exile series
Author: Julian May
Description: Time travellers from the late 21st/early 22nd century go through a one-way time portal to the Earth's Pliocene period, already controlled by humanoid extraterrestrials.

Title: Life, the Universe and Everything
Author: Douglas Adams
Description: Time travel paradoxes form the basis of broad comedy, as in the case of the ancient poet Lallafa.

Title: Millennium
Author: John Varley
Description: In the far distant future, a time-travel team snatches the passengers of a plane collision, leaving prefabricated bodies behind for the rescue teams to find. Basis of the 1989 film.

Title: The Anubis Gates
Author: Tim Powers
Description: In 1983, a millionaire discovers time-travel gates and organizes a trip to the past to attend a lecture by Samuel Taylor Coleridge in 1810. A professor hired by the millionaire is trapped in 19th-century London.

Title: "The Toynbee Convector"
Author: Ray Bradbury
Description: A stagnating civilization of the 1980s is revitalized when a man produces evidence of a future utopia, apparently obtained through time travel. Mankind is inspired by the evidence to actually achieve this utopia.

Title: "The Proteus Operation"
Author: James P. Hogan
Description: In a world dominated by a victorious Third Reich, the besieged forces of freedom mount a covert military mission back to 1939 in a desperate attempt to alter the outcome of World War II.

Title: Star Trek: Ishmael
Author: Barbara Hambly
Description: Spock is aboard a Klingon ship when it travels back in time to Seattle in 1867. He discovers a Klingon plot to destroy the United Federation of Planets by assassinating an ancestor of his mother, a prominent local businessman who will later be instrumental in repelling an invasion by the alien Karsids.

Title: Highway of Eternity
Author: Clifford D. Simak
Description: People from the future run to the past to avoid the fate of being forced into a non-corporeal form.

Title: Running Against Time
Author: Stanley Shapiro
Description: In an effort to prevent the Vietnam War, a man travels back in time to prevent the assassination of John F. Kennedy.

Title: A Tale of Time City
Author: Diana Wynne Jones
Description: A girl, Vivian Smith, is kidnapped while being evacuated from London during World War II, and is caught up in a struggle to preserve history.

Title: Replay
Author: Ken Grimwood
Description: A man in 1988 suffers a heart attack and finds himself back in his life in 1963.

Title: "Ripples in the Dirac Sea"
Author: Geoffrey A. Landis
Description: A man inventing a time machine using Dirac's theories of negative energy travels to the 1960s and discovers he can participate in the past, but not change it (Nebula Award 1989)

Title: Lightning
Author: Dean Koontz
Description: A time traveler from Nazi Germany interferes with the life of a young woman in the future.

Title: Hyperion
Author: Dan Simmons
Description: A great warrior, the Shrike, is sent from the future for an unknown reason. Main characters will travel through time in a very complex timeline.

Title: Four Past Midnight: "The Langoliers"
Author: Stephen King
Description: An airplane accidentally flies through a rip in space/time and appears in the "used time" of yesterday, in which dreadful "Langoliers" eat the past.

Title: The Guns of the South
Author: Harry Turtledove
Description: During American Civil War, South African white supremacists give the Confederacy AK-47s.

Title: From Time to Time
Author: Jack Finney
Description: Use of hypnosis to travel through time.

Title: Doomsday Book
Author: Connie Willis
Description: Travel through time from 2048 to 14th century, constrained by automatic avoidance of paradoxes.

Title: Outlander
Author: Diana Gabaldon
Description: Travel through time from 1940s to 1740s. Woman time travels through standing stones in Scotland.

Title: Dragonfly in Amber
Author: Diana Gabaldon
Description: Time-travel romance, the second of a trilogy (after Outlander, 1991). 1960s to 18th century.

Title: Voyager
Author: Diana Gabaldon
Description: Time-travel romance, the third of the Outlander series. Time travel from the 20th century to 18th century.

Title: The Cross Time Engineer
Author: Leo Frankowski
Description: 20th Century Polish Engineer is transported back to 13th century Poland 10 years before the Mongol invasion.

Title: The Hundred-Light-Year-Diary
Author: Greg Egan
Description: After the invention of a method for sending messages back in time, history of the future becomes common knowledge, and every person knows their own fate.

Title: The Time Ships
Author: Stephen Baxter
Description: Authorised sequel to H. G. Wells' The Time Machine.

Title: Drums of Autumn
Author: Diana Gabaldon
Description: Time-travel romance, the fourth of the Outlander series. Time travel from the 20th century to 18th century.

Title: Timequake
Author: Kurt Vonnegut
Description: People in 2001 are transported back to 1991 to relive their lives.

Title: The Dechronization of Sam Magruder
Author: George Gaylord Simpson
Description: A scientist working in the year 2162 is thrown back in time 80 million years to the Jurassic period.

Title: Pastwatch: The Redemption of Christopher Columbus
Author: Orson Scott Card
Description: Researchers look back in time to see Christopher Columbus's arrival in the New World in order to save the world from ecological disaster.

Title: Animorphs
Author: K. A. Applegate
Description: In book 11, the Animorphs and Visser 3 are sent back a few hours to the Amazon by a Saurio Rip, with the plot used again in Altermorph 1. The same concept is uses to sent the animorphs back to time to 65 million B.C. in Megamorph 2. In the Andalite Chronicles, Elfangor discovers a technology known as the Time Matrix, seen again in Megamorph 3.

Title: "The Devil on the Road"
Author: Robert Westall
Description: A young motorbiker takes shelter in a barn in Suffolk during a storm and is transported back to the 17th Century at the time of the English Civil War.

Title: In the Garden of Iden
Author: Kage Baker
Description: This is the first book of Baker's The Company series, all of which involve time travel.

Title: Making History
Author: Stephen Fry
Description: Two men in the present attempt to prevent the birth of Adolf Hitler.

Title: To Say Nothing of the Dog
Author: Connie Willis
Description: A comedy in which time travelers from 2048 travel back to the 19th century in order to find an artifact for a dictatorial wealthy woman; adventures occur in The Blitz and other occasions.

Title: Corrupting Dr. Nice
Author: John Kessel
Description: Modeled on 1930s screwball comedies; set in Cretaceous, 40 AD Jerusalem and 2060 AD. Features a scene with a dinosaur in a hotel room.

Title: The Transall Saga
Author: Gary Paulsen
Description: A boy gets transported to a weird world by a blue light, only to discover that it is the dark future of planet Earth

Title: Island in the Sea of Time
Author: S. M. Stirling
Description: Nantucket is transported 3000 years back in time because of a space disturbance.

Title: King of Shadows
Author: Susan Cooper
Description: A modern day boy switches places with a Shakespearean actor who needs to be cured by modern medicine so as to return to his own age and help Shakespeare to greater success on the stage.

Title: All of an Instant
Author: Richard Garfinkle
Description: People from three atemporal time tribes must unite to save the crystallization and fracturing of all of history.

Title: Timeline
Author: Michael Crichton
Description: Historians travel to and become stuck in the Middle Ages.

Title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Author: J. K. Rowling
Description: Hogwarts student Hermione Granger acquires a Time-Turner, a magical necklace that allows her to travel back in time on a daily basis in order to take an unusually large courseload. The device is later used to manipulate the events of a single night to aid a wrongly accused convict's escape.

Title: The Light of Other Days
Author: Arthur C. Clarke, Stephen Baxter
Description: Wormhole-based "time viewer" can observe people and events from any point throughout time and space.

Author: Eric Flint
Description: West-Virginian town is taken back to the Thirty Years' War in Germany and gives them insight to the future.

Title: The Fiery Cross
Author: Diana Gabaldon
Description: Time-travel romance, the fifth of the Outlander series. Time travel from the 20th century to 18th century.

Title: The Chronoliths
Author: Robert Charles Wilson
Description: Monuments from the future appear in the early 21st century, precipitating a global political collapse.

Title: Thief of Time
Author: Terry Pratchett
Description: Unfreezing and freezing of time using a small mechanism.

Title: Paratime
Author: H. Beam Piper
Description: Shorts stories of lateral time movement and alternate universes.

Title: Meridian
Author: John Schettler
Description: ForeWord Magazine Silver Medal Winner for Sci-fi Book of The Year, 2002. The first ever experiment in time travel sets off a "Time War" where opposing sides struggle to alter key events on the Meridians of Time. Five book series: Meridian, Nexus Point, Touchstone, Anvil of Fate, Golem 7.

Title: Night Watch
Author: Terry Pratchett
Description: Character interacts with a younger version of himself.

Title: Counting Up, Counting Down
Author: Harry Turtledove
Description: Time travel with the twin perspectives of a man who travels back in time for relationship stability.

Title: Guardian
Author: Joe Haldeman
Description: Born in 1858, Rosa journeys from the Civil War South to the Northeast, marries a villainous husband, and flees with their 14-year-old boy Daniel for the Klondike Gold Rush, all before learning that the talking,shapeshifting raven she sometimes encounters is a Guardian. Raven allows her to journey through space and time, then restores her to her "present" in 1898, now an adjacent universe, with comic and romantic results.

Title: Thief!
Author: Malorie Blackman
Description: A huge storm traps a girl who is accused of being a thief and takes her into the future.

Title: Kaleidoscope Century
Author: John Barnes
Description: Takes place on Mars. A man has a virus that puts him to sleep every 15 years and he wakes 10 younger.

Title: The Eyre Affair
Author: Jasper Fforde
Description: Sleuth Thursday Next gets caught in overlapping vortices of time and alternate reality as a villain tries to eradicate a literary classic.

Title: Haruhi Suzumiya
Author: Nagaru Tanigawa
Description: Two characters, Mikuru Asahina and Fujiwara, are time travelers from the future and many parts of the storyline involve time traveling.

Title: The Time Traveler's Wife
Author: Audrey Niffenegger
Description: Man with a rare genetic disorder unpredictably travels in time, living his life out of sequence.

Title: Axis of Time
Author: John Birmingham
Description: A naval task-force from 2021 is accidentally sent back to the battle of Midway.

Title: The Spark of God (orig. title:L'Éclat de Dieu)
Author: Romain Sardou
Description: Describes the First Crusade and the beginning of the Knights Templar in the future.

Title: Pen Pal
Author: Lou Antonelli
Description: Loops in a man's life told through a narrative that goes from future to present.

Title: Warcraft: War of the Ancients Trilogy
Author: Richard A. Knaak
Description: A human, a dragon and an orc travel back in time to help save Azeroth from the Burning Legion.

Title: A Breath of Snow and Ashes
Author: Diana Gabaldon
Description: Time-travel romance, the sixth of the Outlander series. Time travel from the 20th century to 18th century.

Title: Mammoth
Author: John Varley
Description: Multibillionaire clones a mammoth and sends it back in time.

Title: Sojourn
Author: Jana G. Oliver
Description: A Time Rover from 2057 returns to 1888 London in search of a missing time tourist only to be caught in the Jack the Ripper murders and the history-changing plots of a mysterious group of shape-shifters called Transitives.

Title: The Plot to Save Socrates
Author: Paul Levinson
Description: Time travelers from 2042 to prevent Socrates from consuming hemlock.

Title: Artemis Fowl: The Lost Colony
Author: Eoin Colfer
Description: Fifth book in the Artemis Fowl series. Artemis must pair up with his old comrade Captain Holly Short to track down the missing demon, before the spell that holds a demon island, Hybras, in limbo dissolves completely and the lost demon colony returns violently to Earth. Artemis also ends up saving Holly by manipulating time.

Title: Rant: An Oral Biography of Buster Casey
Author: Chuck Palahniuk
Description: Characters participate in "Party Crashing" which can, under certain conditions, cause time travel.

Title: Meet The Robinsons
Author: Steve Anderson
Description: Principal character meets his future son and then travels to the future to meet his family.

Title: The Accidental Time Machine
Author: Joe Haldeman
Description: A research assistant at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology accidentally creates a forward-traveling time machine. Each leap forward in time, which he takes to get out of trouble, lands him each time in deeper trouble.

Title: The Lifehouse Trilogy
Author: Spider Robinson
Description: 3 books (Mindkiller (1982), Time Pressure (1988), LifeHouse (1997)) chronicle the story of visitors from Earth's future visiting the past to essentially harvest souls.

Title: Virtual Evil
Author: Jana G. Oliver
Description: A Time Rover from 2057 is sent to 1888 London to find Harter Defoe, the first time traveler who is slowly going insane.

Title: Madman's Dance
Author: Jana G. Oliver
Description: Abandoned in a Victorian insane asylum, memories erased, a Time Rover from 2057 must find a way to thwart a plot from the future that will remake British history.

Title: The Little Book
Author: Selden Edwards
Description: The last heir of a Boston banking family wakes up in Vienna in the time leading up to the Second World War. He meets with his father, grandfather, Sigmund Freud, Mark Twain, Mahler and others.

Title: Artemis Fowl: The Time Paradox
Author: Eoin Colfer
Description: Sixth book in the Artemis Fowl series. After Angeline Fowl contracts spelltropy, Artemis travels back in time eight years to when he was ten years old to find a lemur that can help cure his mother. The plot twist in the end of the book creates a circular timeline that started the series.

Title: Found
Author: Margaret Peterson Haddix
Description: Thirteen year olds Jonah and Chip find out that they are missing children from time and go on a journey along with Jonah's sister Katherine to uncover many secrets.

Title: An Echo in the Bone
Author: Diana Gabaldon
Description: Time-travel romance, the seventh of the Outlander series. Time travel from the 20th century to 18th century.

Title: Ruby Red original title: Rubinrot (German)
Author: Kerstin Gier
Description: A story about a girl, Gwendolyn Shepherd, who can travel in time with a machine, called chronograph.

Title: Sent
Author: Margaret Peterson Haddix
Description: Jonah, Katherine, Chip and Alex are sent back to 1483 to learn that Chip is actually King Edward V and Alex is his brother Richard, Duke of York.

Title: Expiration Date
Author: Duane Swierczynski
Description: Hardboiled pulp tale of an ex-journalist who discovers pills in his grandfather's medicine cabinet that transport him back in time to the 1970s.

Title: Sabotaged
Author: Margaret Peterson Haddix
Description: Jonah and Katherine go on yet another mission to return a missing kid named Andrea(really Virginia Dare) to her time in the Roanoke Colony.

Title: Blackout and All Clear
Author: Connie Willis
Description: Time travelers from 2048 go to the London Blitz during World War II to observe and end up being part of it. Novel published in two parts.

Title: How to Live Safely in a Science Fictional Universe
Author: Charles Yu
Description: In search of his father, a time machine mechanic adventures through time accompanied by TAMMY and his ontologically valid dog, Ed, all while documenting his travels in a manual for future travellers.

Title: Time for Patriots
Author: Thomas Wm. Hamilton
Description: A military academy and some neighbors are sent back to 1770 by a physics experiment gone awry. They get involved with Washington, Franklin, the Bey of Algiers, Mozart, and others. The novel ends a month after the first lunar landing, in 1926.

Title: World of Warcraft: Thrall: Twilight of the Aspects
Author: Christie Golden
Description: Thrall, an orc shaman, travels through time and alternative reality in order to find his inner strength.

Author: Stephen King
Description: A man travels through a time portal to 1958, intending to stop Lee Harvey Oswald from shooting John F. Kennedy.

Title: Fairy Tail
Author: Hiro Mashima
Description: Two time travellers : Lucy Heartfilia and Rogue Cheney both use a device called the Eclipse Gate from the Book of Zeref to travel back in time for different purposes.

Title: Amber House
Author: Kelly Moore, Tucker Reed, Larkin Reed
Description: A teen girl uses psychometry to alter events in the past, changing the present and future.

Title: Captain Underpants and the Revolting Revenge of the Radioactive Robo-Boxers
Author: Dav Pilkey
Description: George Beard and Harold Hutchins, two fourth graders, use a homemade time machine to travel 65 million years into the past.

Title: Neverwas
Author: Kelly Moore, Tucker Reed, Larkin Reed
Description: An unforeseen change in the past necessitates the use of psychic abilities to reset the present and future.

Title: A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court
Author: Emmett J. Flynn
Description: The first of several film adaptations of Mark Twain's classic.

Title: Berkeley Square
Author: Frank Lloyd
Description: A contemporary man is transported back to 18th century London where he meets his ancestors and falls in love with a woman of the period.

Title: A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court
Author: Tay Garnett
Description: Very loosely based on Mark Twain's story in which a mechanic (Bing Crosby) is knocked out and wakes up in the land of King Arthur.

Title: The Undead
Author: Roger Corman
Description: A woman is sent back in time via hypnosis to the Middle Ages, where she may be executed by the people of that time on suspicion of being a witch.

Title: The Time Machine
Author: George Pal
Description: Loose adaption of H. G. Wells's classic in which a time traveler enters a future where the world is broken up into two classes, the peaceful Eloi and the malevolent masters of the world, the Morlocks.

Title: La jetée
Author: Chris Marker
Description: The hero is haunted by a memory from his childhood, which turns out to be himself as an adult. (La jetée inspired the full-length feature 12 Monkeys.)

Title: The Time Travelers
Author: Ib Melchior
Description: A time travel experiment that was supposed to produce a window into different times is actually a portal.

Title: Dr. Who and the Daleks
Author: Gordon Flemyng
Description: Based on the BBC TV series. In this, the Doctor is an inventor not an alien. His TARDIS device takes the Doctor and companions to the future of an alien world.

Title: Daleks – Invasion Earth: 2150 A.D.
Author: Gordon Flemyng
Description: Based on the BBC TV series. In this the Doctor is an inventor not an alien. His TARDIS device takes the Doctor and companions to a future London devastated by war.

Title: Journey to the Center of Time
Author: David L. Hewitt
Description: Scientists develop a time machine and travel to the far future and the distant past. A remake of The Time Travelers.

Title: Planet of the Apes
Author: Franklin J. Schaffner
Description: George Taylor (played by Charlton Heston) travels to a future Earth inhabited by intelligent talking apes.

Title: Beneath the Planet of the Apes
Author: Ted Post
Description: Another astronaut, Brent, travels to the future Earth ruled by apes. His search for Taylor leads to an underground city of nuclear mutants.

Title: Escape from the Planet of the Apes
Author: Don Taylor
Description: Three apes escape Earth's destruction by salvaging and repairing the astronaut Taylor's spaceship and piloting it through a time warp back to 1973.

Title: Slaughterhouse-Five
Author: George Roy Hill
Description: A man travels to various times and places from his life in addition to another planet.

Title: Idaho Transfer
Author: Peter Fonda
Description: Due to an impending disaster that threatens to destroy mankind, a time machine is built by a group of young scientists to transport themselves into the future to rebuild civilization.

Title: Ivan Vasilievich: Back to the Future
Author: Leonid Gaidai
Description: Engineer Shurik has invented a time machine in his apartment. By accident, he sends two people back into the time of Ivan IV while the real Ivan IV is sent by the same machine into Shurik's apartment.

Title: Superman
Author: Richard Donner
Description: Superman circles the Earth at tremendous speeds allowing him to travel back in time to just before an earthquake created by Lex Luthor.

Title: Time After Time
Author: Nicholas Meyer
Description: Using a time machine, Jack the Ripper and H. G. Wells travel from 1893 London to 1979 San Francisco.

Title: The Final Countdown
Author: Don Taylor
Description: A storm at sea transports a nuclear warship back in time from the 1980s to the 1940s.

Title: Somewhere in Time
Author: Jeannot Szwarc
Description: A young man sees an old photograph of a woman, and through hypnosis travels back in time from 1980 to 1912 to meet her. Based on Matheson's 1975 novel "Bid Time Return"

Title: Time Bandits
Author: Terry Gilliam
Description: A young boy unwittingly joins a band of dwarves as they travel through time hunting treasure.

Title: Timerider: The Adventure of Lyle Swann
Author: William Dear
Description: The hero travels by means of "time cannons".

Title: Twilight Zone: The Movie
Author: John Landis, Steven Spielberg, Joe Dante andGeorge Miller
Description: Big-screen adaptations of three classic episodes from the popular 1950s and 1960s Rod Serling television series, plus a new segment featuring a bigot who is transported into the lives of past victims of racism.

Title: The Terminator
Author: James Cameron
Description: A cyborg (played by Arnold Schwarzenegger) is sent back in time from 2029 to 1984 to destroy humanity by killing the future mother of its future savior.

Title: The Philadelphia Experiment
Author: Stewart Raffill
Description: In 1943, an anti-radar experiment accidentally sends two sailors forward in time to 1984. Nancy Allen and Michael Paré star in this film.

Title: Non ci resta che piangere
Author: Roberto Benigni andMassimo Troisi
Description: The school janitor Mario (Massimo Troisi) and the teacher Saverio (Roberto Benigni) have an automobile breakdown, decide to spend the night in an inn, and the next morning they awake in the Florence of the 16th century.

Title: Back to the Future
Author: Robert Zemeckis
Description: Time travel is achieved by means of a flux capacitor installed in a DeLorean DMC12 sports car. Marty McFly intervenes in his parents' first meeting, preventing them from falling in love, and placing his own existence in danger.

Title: Trancers
Author: Charles Band
Description: Jack Deth is a kind of cop/bounty hunter in a future dystopic Los Angeles.

Title: My Science Project
Author: Jonathan R. Betuel
Description: Michael and Ellie break into a military junkyard to find a science project. They find an orb that dangerously bends time and have to stop it to save the world.

Title: The Blue Yonder
Author: Mark Rossman
Description: An 11-year-old goes back in time to prevent his grandfather from making a fatal plane flight across the Atlantic. Aired on The Disney Sunday Movie under the name Time Flyer. [2] [3]

Title: Peggy Sue Got Married
Author: Francis Ford Coppola
Description: Peggy Sue Bodell faints at her high school reunion. When she wakes up, she finds herself in her own past, just before she finished high school.

Title: Biggles: Adventures in Time
Author: John Hough
Description: Unassuming catering salesman Jim Ferguson falls through a time hole to 1917 where he saves the life of dashing Royal Flying Corps pilot James "Biggles" Bigglesworth after his photo recon mission is shot down. Before he can work out what has happened, Jim is zapped back to the 1980s.

Title: Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home
Author: Leonard Nimoy
Description: To save Earth, Admiral James T. Kirk and his crew travel back in time to retrieve the beings who can communicate with an alien probe (humpback whales).

Title: Outlaws
Author: Nicholas Corea
Description: Five cowboys of the 1880s are sent forward through time 100 years and fight crime.

Title: Flight of the Navigator
Author: Randal Kleiser
Description: In 1978, a boy winds up 8 years into the future, and discovers an alien spaceship brought him there.

Title: Kin-dza-dza
Author: Georgiy Daneliya
Description: A Russian dystopian comedy. Uncle Vova asks a person from the planet Alpha to move him and Fiddler back in time to save two aliens who got imprisoned because of the main hero's actions.

Title: Masters of the Universe
Author: David Odell
Description: The villain uses a camcorder-like gadget that shows the past, and an inventor opens up wormholes to other timestreams allowing the heroine (a young Courteney Cox) to save her parents from dying.

Title: Timestalkers
Author: Michael Schulz
Description: A professor who's lost his family finds evidence of a time traveller in Old West memorabilia.

Title: The Navigator: A Medieval Odyssey
Author: Vincent Ward
Description: Medieval travelers from 14th century England tunnel through Earth and burst into 20th century New Zealand.

Title: Field of Dreams
Author: Phil Alden Robinson
Description: Major league baseball players from the early 20th century time travel to the present year of 1989. When Ray Kinsella is in Minnesota searching for former major-leaguer "Moonlight" Graham, he is mysteriously transported from 1989 to 1972 where he encounters Graham as an elderly doctor.

Title: Back to the Future Part II
Author: Robert Zemeckis
Description: Sequel to Back to the Future, Part II follows Marty McFly and Doc Brown as they go to the year 2015 to prevent Marty's kids from ruining the McFly family's reputation. Along the way, an old Biff Tannen steals the DeLorean so he can give a sports almanac to himself in the past, and win millions of dollars gambling. This creates a hellish alternate 1985 that it's up to Marty and the Doc to correct.

Title: Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure
Author: Stephen Herek
Description: Two teenagers (Alex Winter and Keanu Reeves) will not graduate from high school unless they pull an "A" on their history project. A time traveler (George Carlin) visits them to help because their success on this report is vital as it ensures they will stay together to create a Utopian future. As Bill & Ted travel through time, they encounter historical figures including Socrates, Joan of Arc, and Billy the Kid.

Title: Millennium
Author: Michael Anderson
Description: Time travelers from the far future steal people already destined to die, such as in plane crashes, in order to restock humankind in their own desolate future. Based on the 1983 John Varley novel.

Title: Warlock
Author: Steve Miner
Description: A warlock in the 17th century who has been sentenced to death for witch craft is transported to the 20th century, followed by a witch hunter who must stop the warlock finding the Grand Grimoire.

Title: Frankenstein Unbound
Author: Roger Corman
Description: A scientist creates a weapon that causes your enemy to disappear but has a side effect of causing shifts in time. The scientist is transported back in time to 1817 and he meets Doctor Frankenstein and his monster as well as Mary Shelley, who in this film wrote her novel based on true events.

Title: Back to the Future Part III
Author: Robert Zemeckis
Description: Sequel to Back to the Future Part II. In the final installment of the trilogy, Marty McFly goes back to 1885 to stop an outlaw from killing Doc Brown in a duel, and bring him back home to 1985.

Title: Terminator 2: Judgment Day
Author: James Cameron
Description: Sequel to The Terminator.

Title: Bill & Ted's Bogus Journey
Author: Peter Hewitt
Description: Sequel to Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure. Two evil robot versions of Bill & Ted are sent back in time to kill them.

Title: Army of Darkness
Author: Sam Raimi
Description: Central character Ash (Bruce Campbell), a supermarket employee, is sent back in time by a specific book to the 14th century.

Title: Freejack
Author: Geoff Murphy
Description: The rich in a future where time travel has been invented snatch people from history a moment before their death in order to use the bodies as hosts for their own minds after death.

Title: Timescape (or:Grand Tour: Disaster in Time)
Author: David Twohy
Description: Ben Wilson and daughter Hillary are visited by a strange group of travelers looking for lodging. The travelers are from the future, intending to witness an impending catastrophe. Based on the novel Vintage Season by Henry Kuttnerand C.L. Moore.

Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles III
Author: Stuart Gillard
Description: The turtles go back in time to feudal Japan to retrieve a kidnapped April.

Title: Les Visiteurs
Author: Jean-Marie Poiré
Description: A 12th-century knight and his servant travel in time to the end of the 20th century and find themselves adrift in modern society.

Title: The Philadelphia Experiment II
Author: Stephen Cornwell
Description: A disastrous experiment in 1993 sends a stealth aircraft through a time portal, into 1943 Germany. A sailor is pulled into the portal, and finds himself in the terrifying 1993 that resulted from a Nazi victory in World War II.

Author: Jack Sholder
Description: Barry Thomas is an average office worker. He becomes attracted to Lisa, a scientist in the same company. After work, Barry witnesses the murder of Lisa and goes to a bar to get drunk. That night, there is a storm and Barry gets a shock from a lamp's faulty power wire at exactly 12:01 a.m. The next few days, he realizes the world is trapped in a time loop, with himself the only one aware of it. Barry must prevent Lisa's murder and stop the time loop or be caught in time forever.

Title: Groundhog Day
Author: Harold Ramis
Description: Weatherman Phil Connors is trapped in 2 February in the town of Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania when he finds the same day repeating over and over.

Title: Time Chasers
Author: David Giancola
Description: An amateur inventor goes through time with an airplane to stop a villain from changing history for profit.

Title: A.P.E.X.
Author: Phillip J. Roth
Description: A time-travel experiment in which a robot probe is sent from the year 2073 to the year 1973 goes terribly wrong thrusting one of the project scientists, a man named Nicholas Sinclair into a plague ravaged alternate time-line whose war weary inhabitants are locked in a constant battle with killer robots which are automatically being sent there from Sinclair's lab. To escape this situation, Sinclair must find a similar time machine in this alternate world and prevent the disaster from ever happening.

Title: Star Trek Generations
Author: David Carson
Description: USS Enterprise Captains James T. Kirk and Jean-Luc Picard meet through the effects of an energy ribbon.

Title: Timecop
Author: Peter Hyams
Description: Includes a prohibition against changing the past. The Time Enforcement Commission (TEC) is created to prevent alterations to the past. This causes a dilemma for the hero, Max Walker, who has to prevent time-travelers from altering time, but is tempted to do so to prevent his wife's death.

Title: 12 Monkeys
Author: Terry Gilliam
Description: James Cole tries to change the past but fails. It therefore runs on the principle of a fixed timeline (the Novikov self-consistency principle).

Title: Doctor Who
Author: Geoffrey Sax
Description: This film involves the Doctor in his eighth incarnation and has a showdown with the Master.

Title: Star Trek: First Contact
Author: Jonathan Frakes
Description: The USS Enterprise follows the Borg back in time to stop them from altering history and preventing Earth's first warp flight and first contact with the Vulcans.

Title: Time Under Fire [1]
Author: Jeff Fahey
Description: A US submarine runs into a time rift. A special unit goes on a mission to see what's on the other side. They find themselves in an alternate dystopian America, now a one-man dictatorship. They decide to help the rebels.

Title: Time at the Top[2]
Author: Timothy Busfield, Elisha Cuthbert, Gabrielle Boni,Matthew Harbour
Description: 14-year old Susan Shawson travels back in time in her building's elevator, as altered by a retired physicist living in her building. It transports her from Philadelphia of 1998 back to the same place in other years depending on the order of buttons pushed. In 1881 she meets Victoria Walker, a girl her own age in need of assistance with her own family problems. Gradually discovering the power of her time machine, Susan, Victoria, and her young brother Robert travel back and forth in time and succeed in changing both the past and the future.

Title: Lost in Space
Author: Stephen Hopkins
Description: In 2058, a family undertakes a voyage to a nearby star system to begin large-scale emigration from a soon-to-be uninhabitable Earth, but are thrown off course by a saboteur and must try to find their way home.

Title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
Author: Jay Roach
Description: Dr. Evil is back and has invented a time machine that allows him to go back to the 1960s so he can steal Austin Powers' mojo.

Title: Galaxy Quest
Author: Dean Parisot
Description: A jump back in time of 13 seconds is all the time lead actor Jason Nesmith (Tim Allen) needs to save his crew from being killed.

Title: The Time Shifters
Author: Mario Philip Azzopardi
Description: A reporter, learning of time travelers visiting 20th century disasters, tries to change the history they know by averting upcoming disasters.

Title: S Club 7: Back to the 50's [3]
Author: Andrew Margetson
Description: A music group finds a time portal while on their way to Los Angeles and find themselves in a desert town in the year 1959 under the control of a gang with a corrupted sheriff as an ally. The group learns about the fate of a local chef at a diner and tries to prevent certain disaster despite threats against them from both the sheriff and the gang.

Title: Frequency
Author: Gregory Hoblit
Description: An accidental cross-time radio link connects father and son across 30 years. The son tries to save his father's life, but then must fix the consequences.

Title: Ditto
Author: Kim Jeong-gwon
Description: Two people separated in time are somehow able to talk to each other using an amateur radio. The people in question are two students in the same school, one in 1979, the other in 2000.

Title: Disney's The Kid
Author: Jon Turteltaub
Description: A 40-year old image consultant (Bruce Willis) finds himself being visited by his 10-year old self.

Title: Il Mare
Author: Lee Hyun-seung
Description: The two protagonists both live in a lake house two years apart in time, but are able to communicate through a mysterious post box. This movie inspired the 2006 American film The Lake House.

Title: Black Knight
Author: Gil Junger
Description: After falling into a theme park's fetid moat, a custodian (Martin Lawrence) crawls out into fourteenth century England. The Middle Ages will never be the same.

Title: Donnie Darko
Author: Richard Kelly
Description: A teenager travels through time using wormholes, a man in a bunny suit, and the modern ritual of sleeping on golf courses.

Title: Just Visiting
Author: Jean-Marie Poiré
Description: A medieval knight and his serf travel to 21st century Chicago, meeting the knight's descendant. But they must travel back to their time to ensure her birth.

Title: Kate & Leopold
Author: James Mangold
Description: A Duke time travels from 1876 to the present and falls in love with a career woman in New York.

Title: Pokémon 4Ever
Author: Kunihiko Yuyama Jim Malone
Description: The film focuses on Celebi who travels to the future and returns with a boy named Sam when being chased by a hunter.

Title: Returner
Author: Takashi Yamazaki
Description: The human race is on the edge of annihilation after decades of war with an alien force. In an outpost in Tibet, mankind's last hope of survival is a time travel device.

Title: The Time Machine
Author: Simon Wells
Description: Remake of 1960s version of the film, directed by H. G. Wells' great-grandson, has little in common with H. G. Wells's original novel.

Title: Time Changer
Author: Rich Christiano
Description: A Bible professor from 1890 comes forward in time to the present via a time machine and cannot believe the things that he sees.

Title: Timequest
Author: Robert Dyke
Description: A time traveler changes history by warning Jackie Kennedy about the future.

Title: Austin Powers in Goldmember
Author: Jay Roach
Description: Upon learning that his father has been kidnapped, Austin Powers must travel to 1975 and defeat the villain Goldmember – who is working with Dr. Evil.

Title: Das Jesus Video
Author: Sebastian Niemann
Description: In Israel, a student in archaeology is seeking a video camera hidden 2000 years ago by a mysterious time traveler.

Title: Bottom Live 2003: Weapons Grade Y-Fronts Tour
Author: Rick Mayall
Description: Eddie Hitler builds a time traveling toilet which he calls the TURDIS.

Title: Timeline
Author: Richard Donner
Description: Film adaptation of the book by Michael Crichton.

Title: Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines
Author: Jonathan Mostow
Description: Sequel to The Terminator and Terminator 2: Judgment Day.

Title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Author: Alfonso Cuarón
Description: Hermione Granger receives a Time-Turner from Professor McGonagall, so she can attend more classes than time would normally allow. She and Harry later use the Time-Turner to save Sirius Black and Buckbeak.

Title: Primer
Author: Shane Carruth
Description: Time travelers can only use the time machine to travel to when the machine was first turned on. But you can bring a second running time machine back with you and after leaving the first machine, climb in the second. Aaron obsessively returns to a party one night to prevent a murder and become a hero.

Title: The Butterfly Effect
Author: Eric Bress & J. Mackye Gruber
Description: A college psychology student (Ashton Kutcher) learns he can temporarily travel to his past and change it. The time traveling in this film involves a process initiated by reading childhood journals.

Title: 13 Going on 30
Author: Gary Winick
Description: A 13-year old girl makes a birthday wish and wakes up as a 30-year old woman.

Title: Fetching Cody
Author: David Ray
Description: Distraught over his drug-addicted girlfriend, Cody (Sarah Lind), who's overdosed and fallen into a coma, small-time dope peddler Art (Jay Baruchel) uses a time machine to journey into the past in a desperate gamble to change her future.

Title: The Jacket
Author: John Maybury
Description: A amnesiac Persian Gulf War veteran (Adrien Brody) is subjected to an experimental treatment which moves him forward 15 years.

Title: A Sound of Thunder
Author: Peter Hyams
Description: For an extraordinary price, Time Safaris, Inc. will take clients through a wormhole to a time in pre-history to hunt dinosaur game. Based loosely on the 1952 short story by Ray Bradbury, with the Butterfly Effect portrayed as much more pronounced.

Title: Summer Time Machine Blues
Author: Katsuyuki Motohiro
Description: Five college boys in a sci-fi club break their air-conditioner's remote control. In the sweltering clubhouse, a time machine appears and they go back in time to retrieve a functioning controller, but this causes complications.

Title: The Lake House
Author: Alejandro Agresti
Description: Time travel romance where two people living in the same house at a lake at different times are able to exchange letters through its mailbox and fall in love.

Title: Click
Author: Frank Coraci
Description: Adam Sandler is given a remote that lets him fast forward, pause, and rewind his life.

Title: The Girl Who Leapt Through Time
Author: Mamoru Hosoda
Description: A teenage girl discovers that she can leap through time.

Title: Déjà Vu
Author: Tony Scott
Description: Denzel Washington is an ATF agent investigating a terrorist act who is invited to assist in a government time travel surveillance project.

Title: Idiocracy
Author: Mike Judge
Description: Luke Wilson as Corporal Joe Bauers (later "Not Sure") a U.S. Army librarian, along with a prostitute named Rita are selected for a suspended animation experiment which is supposed to last one year but which is forgotten for five hundred years.

Title: Bender's Big Score
Author: Dwayne Carey-Hill
Description: Alien scammers discover the code for time travel tattooed on Philip J. Fry's buttocks, and use it to send Bender back in time to steal priceless artifacts.

Title: Disney's Meet the Robinsons
Author: Stephen J. Anderson
Description: Young Lewis is taken to the year 2037 by his future son Wilbur to stop a "Bowler Hat Guy" who has stolen Lewis' memory scanning machine.

Title: Premonition
Author: Mennan Yapo
Description: House wife (Sandra Bullock) learns that her husband died in a car crash the previous day, but wakes up next morning to find him well and alive, and awakens the next day to a time when it has been a few weeks since he had died.

Title: Timecrimes
Author: Nacho Vigalondo
Description: A man accidentally travels back to the past and meets himself there.

Title: Minutemen
Author: Lev L. Spiro
Description: Three high-school outcasts use a time machine that one invented to save their classmates from embarrassing moments. Their time-travel creates a black hole, which could destroy the world.

Title: Stargate: Continuum
Author: Martin Wood
Description: Ba'al (Cliff Simon) changes the timeline so that SG-1 or the Stargate program never existed. Three people were unaffected by the change but are unable to do anything until Ba'al and the system lords arrive.

Title: Star Trek
Author: J. J. Abrams
Description: Spock's attempt to prevent a supernova fails, resulting in the destruction of the Romulan homeworld. The captain of a Romulan mining ship blames Spock, and both the Romulans and Spock fall through a black hole to the past, creating an alternate reality.

Title: Mr. Nobody
Author: Jaco Van Dormael
Description: A romantic drama about Nemo Nobody (Jared Leto), a 118-year-old man and the last mortal on Earth, who can predict the future and tells of alternate life paths, often changing course with the flick of a decision.

Title: The Time Traveler's Wife
Author: Robert Schwentke
Description: A romantic drama about a Chicago librarian (Eric Bana) with a gene that causes him to involuntarily time travel, and the complications it creates for his marriage. Based on the Audrey Niffenegger novel.

Title: Frequently Asked Questions About Time Travel
Author: Gareth Carrivick
Description: Two geeks and a cynic attempt to navigate a time-travel conundrum in the middle of a British pub. Faris plays a girl from the Future who sets the adventure in motion.

Title: Disney's A Christmas Carol
Author: Robert Zemeckis
Description: Miserly moneylender Ebenezer Scrooge is visited by the ghosts of Christmas Past, Present and Future, in order to change his ways.

Title: Action Replayy
Author: Vipul Amrutlal Shah
Description: A young man named Bunty uses a time machine created by his girlfriend's grandfather to meet his own parents before they were married, and help them develop a more loving relationship.

Title: The Disappearance of Haruhi Suzumiya
Author: Tatsuya Ishihara
Description: Kyon is the only one who knows two of his classmates are missing and everything is different. To restore his life, he gathers several keys to power an alien device and travel back three years.

Title: Hot Tub Time Machine
Author: Steve Pink
Description: Four friends spend a crazy, drunken night in a hot tub at a ski resort only to travel back in time to 1986. They are each presented with an opportunity to alter their futures. The film stars John Cusack, Rob Corddry, Craig Robinson, and Clark Duke.

Title: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time
Author: Mike Newell
Description: Disney's adaption of the video game of the same name. A dagger is used to turn back the clock; it has a grip made of crystal through which a special "Sand of Time" has to flow in order to create the time transition effect. The Prince (Jake Gyllenhaal) has to prevent someone from changing history.

Title: Yu-Gi-Oh! 3D: Bonds Beyond Time
Author: Kenichi Takeshita
Description: Series protagonist Yusei Fudo encounters Turbo Duelist Paradox, who is from the future, and who believes the only way to prevent his future from happening is to stop Duel Monsters from existing.

Title: Ticking Clock
Author: Ernie Barbarash
Description: James is a guy from the year 2032 who comes back in time with a custom-made watch that is a time machine. He travels back in time to fix his life but fails.

Title: Source Code
Author: Duncan Jones
Description: Captain Colter Stevens (Jake Gyllenhaal) died in a helicopter crash and has been inserted in a computer program called Source Code which transfers him to the body of a deceased person for the last eight minutes of his life. He cannot change the past, since Source Code is not a time machine, but he can alter events and change the future to avoid a terrorist attack.

Title: Midnight in Paris
Author: Woody Allen
Description: While visiting Paris with his fiancee, an American writer (Owen Wilson) discovers a way to travel back to the 1920s, allowing him to mingle with and draw inspiration from historical greats such as Ernest Hemingway, F. Scott Fitzgerald, and Gertrude Stein.

Title: The Man From The Future
Author: Cláudio Torres
Description: A brilliant physicist spends 20 years developing a time machine, then he cames back in time and try to do everything different.

Title: Safety Not Guaranteed
Author: Colin Trevorrow
Description: Comedy film inspired by a 1997 Backwoods Home Magazine classified ad by a person asking for someone to accompany him in time travel.

Title: Men in Black 3
Author: Barry Sonnenfeld
Description: Agent J travels back in time to MIB's early years in the 1960s in order to stop an alien from assassinating his friend Agent K and changing history.

Title: Looper
Author: Rian Johnson
Description: Criminal organizations abuse time travel to kill humans and avoid tracking of their bodies.

Title: Quantum of Vengeance [4]
Author: Ben Wydeven
Description: In 1998, as a young girl, Emily Freeman witnesses her father being brutally murdered. 14 years later, her professor reveals that he has successfully built a time machine, which inspires her to go back in time and seek vengeance.

Title: Dimensions [5]
Author: Sloane U’Ren
Description: Time travel, love and betrayal in 1920s England. A brilliant scientist becomes obsessed with revisiting his past - no matter what the cost. Jealousy, desires and greed surround him, clouding his judgement and sending him spiralling - towards madness.

Title: The A.R.K. Report
Author: Harry Moskoff
Description: A short film. A young girl travels into the future in order to find the ancient Ark of the Covenant and prevent it from falling into the hands of an evil army.

Title: About Time
Author: Richard Curtis
Description: Tim's father tells his son that the men in his family have always had the ability to travel through time. Tim can't change history, but he can change what happens and has happened in his own life.

Title: Captain Z-Ro
Author: Roy Steffens
Description: Scientist Captain Z-Ro, working in his remote laboratory, safeguarded mankind and history from impending harm. He had a time machine, the ZX-99, both to view history and to send someone back in time.

Title: Doctor Who
Description: A Time Lord known as "the Doctor" travels through time and space in a TARDIS (Time And Relative Dimension In Space).

Title: It's About Time
Author: Sherwood Schwartz
Description: Two astronauts who break the speed of light, accidentally travel back in time to prehistoric Earth. When they realise that they are unable to return, they make friends with the cave-people they encounter. Eventually, they are able to return, but inadvertently bring some of the cave-people with them who then have to learn how to get along in the 1960s.

Title: The Time Tunnel
Author: Irwin Allen
Description: The year is 1968, and Doug Phillips and Tony Newman are working on a top secret project beneath the Arizona desert called "tic-toc". The project has been 10 years in the making, and a visiting senator wants to see if this project really works, or he will cut the funding for it. To prove that it can work, Tony Newman turns on the time tunnel and goes back to the year 1912, and is on board the Titanic, which would sink hours later. Doug Phillips goes into the tunnel to help Tony, and both are stuck hapless in time. They are catapulted each week to a new adventure in history.

Title: Catweazle
Author: Richard Carpenter
Description: 11th century wizard accidentally ensorcels his way into the 20th. Humorous mistakes are made.

Title: Timeslip
Author: John Cooper
Description: Two time traveling children visit both the past and future.

Title: Sapphire & Steel
Author: Peter J. Hammond
Description: Two time traveling inter-dimensional agents protect and guard the order of time in this British drama.

Title: Voyagers!
Author: James D. Parriott
Description: A member of a league of time travelers and a boy travel through time repairing errors in world history.

Title: Moondial (TV serial)
Author: Helen Cresswell
Description: After a family tragedy, a young girl is transported into the past.

Title: Red Dwarf
Author: Rob Grant & Doug Naylor
Description: Having been in suspended animation for 3 million years, Dave Lister leaves stasis as the last human being alive. The Red Dwarf (the ship he is on) is in deep space and travelling at nearly the speed of light. Time travel occurs in this incident, as well as on many other occasions in the series - usually into the past.

Title: Quantum Leap
Author: Donald P. Bellisario
Description: Dr. Sam Beckett (Scott Bakula) helped to develop Quantum Leap, a project that would allow a person to time travel back to any point since that person was born. Beckett ended up being the test subject, and while he could remember only certain details, he traded places with a person in the past. Others in the past saw the other person instead of Beckett. In the present, an observer named Al (Dean Stockwell), whom Beckett could see as a hologram, gave Beckett advice. This usually involved having Beckett correct some problem in the other person's life.

Title: Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventures
Description: Animated spin off of the movies Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure and Bill & Ted's Bogus Journey

Title: Back to the Future: The Animated Series
Author: Bob Gale
Description: Continues on from Back to the Future Part III.

Title: Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventures
Description: Live action spin off of the movies Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure and Bill & Ted's Bogus Journey

Title: Goodnight Sweetheart
Author: Laurence Marks andMaurice Gran
Description: An accidental time traveller, Gary Sparrow, leads a double life after discovering a time portal allowing him to travel between 1990s London and wartime London of 1939–1945.

Title: Time Trax
Author: Creators: Harve Bennett, Jeffrey M. Hayes, Grant Rosenberg·
Description: A police officer from the 22nd century (Dale Midkiff) makes his way back to our time to track down fugitives from the future.

Title: Mega Man (TV series)
Description: In the episode "Future Shock", Mega Man is accidentally booted to the future by Dr. Light’s new time machine, where he discovers that because he wasn’t in the past to stop Dr. Wily, the evil scientist has taken over the planet. Mega Man must find his way back to his own time so that he can reverse this horrible future.

Title: Stargate: SG-1
Author: Peter DeLuise
Description: On their journeys through the Stargate, an elite special forces squad called SG-1 experiences time travel both to the past and future.

Title: Crime Traveller
Author: Anthony Horowitz
Description: Jeff Slade (Michael French) uses a time machine created by colleague Holly Turner's father to solve crimes. The machine operates seemingly-randomly, sending the user(s) back in time a time that can be a matter of minutes, or several days.

Title: Seven Days
Author: Christopher & Zachary Crowe
Description: NSA Agent Frank B. Parker can travel back 7 days in a time machine powered by alien technology.

Title: Mirai Sentai Timeranger
Description: Four policemen travel from the year 3000 to the year 2000 to arrest fugitives.

Title: Star Trek: Enterprise
Author: Creators: Rick Berman,Brannon Braga
Description: Various species from the 30th century are having a "Temporal Cold war" that is interfering with life in the 22nd century, which affects the lives of the USS Enterprise (NX-01) and its crew.

Title: Samurai Jack
Author: Genndy Tartakovsky
Description: An ancient demon throws the hero Samurai Jack into the future, in order to allow himself enough time to conquer the world.

Title: Time Squad
Author: Dave Wasson
Description: Time cops from the year 1,000,000,000 A.D. travel back in time to keep famous historical figures from diverting the course of history. A Cartoon Network series.

Title: Odyssey 5
Author: Manny Coto, David Carson
Description: Astronauts (including Peter Weller and Sebastian Roché) are sent back in time after witnessing the end of the Earth from space.

Title: Do Over
Author: Rick Wiener and Kenny Schwarz
Description: Joel Larsen (Penn Badgley), a 34-year old man, gets a second chance to get his life right, thanks to a freakish accident that catapults him back to 1981, as a 14-year old. He is electrocuted, then wakes up in his teenage body, but with all his adult memories intact. Blessed with adult wisdom, though hampered by adolescent urges, Joel sets out to right the wrongs that will befall his family.

Title: That Was Then
Author: Dan Cohn, Jeff Kline, Jeremy Miller
Description: A 30-year-old who regrets a lot of his mistakes from the past finds himself back in high school, getting a chance to do some things over.

Title: Tru Calling
Author: Jon Harmon Feldman
Description: A young woman (Eliza Dushku) who works in the city morgue receives requests from corpses to stop their untimely deaths and then wakes up the day before, in order to attempt to save them.

Title: 5ive Days to Midnight
Author: Robert Zappia, David Aaron Cohen, Anthony Peckham and Cindy Myers
Description: When college professor J.T. Neumeyer (Timothy Hutton) discovers a police file that outlines the details of his murder - which is to take place five days in the future - he wastes no time trying to save his own life.

Title: Lost
Author: Damon Lindelof & Carlton Cuse
Description: Desmond Hume, former Royal Scots Regimen, is caused by electromagnetic radiation to become "unstuck in time." His consciousness switches between 2004 (the present) and 1996. Benjamin Linus, former leader of the island natives, travels ten months into the future after moving the island. In Season 5, the characters on the island skip through time to different periods of the island's past and future.

Title: Stargate: Atlantis
Author: Martin Wood
Description: Both John Sheppard and Dr. Elizabeth Weir experience time travel when dealing with various ancient devices, among them the Stargate.

Title: Phil of the Future
Author: Tim Maile and Douglas Tuber
Description: A family attempts to repair their spaceship after being stranded in the past, or modern day, while maintaining the appearance of being normal people. Ricky Ullman starred.

Title: Time Warp Trio
Author: Executive producer: Jim Rapsas
Description: A children's cartoon where, using books, three children travel through time and space. Based on the books by Jon Scieszka.

Title: Torchwood
Author: Russell T Davies, Chris Chibnall,  Jane Espenson,  John Fay
Description: Humans and aliens alike from different periods in time start to come through to our world by means of a rift in the space/time continuum. (Spin-off from Doctor Who.)

Title: Heroes
Author: Tim Kring
Description: Hiro Nakamura (Masi Oka) and Peter Petrelli (Milo Ventimiglia) can travel in time and space. This is the foundation for the plot of both series one and series two, in which apocalyptic disasters happen and the characters travel back and forth in an attempt to prevent them.

Title: Life on Mars
Author: Matthew Graham, Ashley Pharoah, Tony Jordan, Chris Chibnall
Description: A police officer, Sam Tyler (played by John Simm), must learn to adapt to the way things were done in the 70s after being thrown back in time by an accident. ( U.S. version of the series, Life on Mars, starring Jason O'Mara, aired in 2008–2009.)

Title: Transformers: Cybertron
Description: The Autobot Vector Prime is a defender of spacetime, he saved your friends human using your power over time, did before of destroy them, by Megatron.

Title: Day Break
Author: Paul Zbyszewski
Description: A cop must relive the day when his girlfriend gets murdered so that he can prevent it from happening. A suspenseful variation on the Groundhog Day concept.

Title: Phineas and Ferb
Author: Dan Povenmire and Jeff Marsh
Description: In one episode, Phineas and Ferb "fix" an old model of a time machine at a museum which allows them to travel back to the age of the dinosaurs, and eventually back to the future again. In another episode, they used this same time machine again to travel into the future. This time, a much more complicated series of events followed, where their future sister follows them back through time and accidentally disrupts the normal course of various events, setting off a chain reaction that turns the future into a dystopian society.

Title: Primeval
Description: Portals to different time periods start opening up and creatures from the past and future start to come through. There are indications that the portals are man-made, but their exact origin is shrouded in mystery.

Title: Kamen Rider Den-O
Description: The protagonists must work with and fight creatures known as Imagin who come from a possible future and have come back in time to kill the key figure to the Junction Point: a human whose sole existence ensures that the Imagin's future cannot exist. The Imagin grant wishes to weak-willed humans to travel farther back in time along that person's memories in order to find the Junction Point by destroying anyone and anything in their way to change the future.

Title: Journeyman
Author: Kevin Falls, Matt McGuinness, Tom Szentgyorgyi
Description: Dan Vasser is the main protagonist of the series, who finds himself jumping through time, unable to stop or control the jumps. Olivia "Livia" Beale is also a traveler from 1948 who jumps into the future. After not being able to jump home, she was stuck in Dan's present and adapted to life there, where she began a legal career and fell in love with Dan, only to finally jump back home while on the plane. For unknown reasons, she now jumps to the same times that Dan visits, and offers him advice and assistance in his missions.

Title: Ashes to Ashes
Author: Matthew Graham, Ashley Pharoah, Julie Rutterford, Mark Greig, Jack Lothian
Description: Spin off series from "Life on Mars" set in 1980s

Title: Kamen Rider Kiva
Description: Parallel storylines taking place in 1986 and 2008 are told, with two of the protagonists from the 2008 timeline going back in time to 1986. The latter time traveler goes back in time to attempt to prevent his birth such that his love may live, but instead ensures that his existence remains by saving his father from being killed by the series' antagonist.

Title: Fringe
Description: In season 4 and 5 of Fringe, time travel is used by the Observers in means to take over human civilization in 2015. Olivia and her team are sent from the year 2015 to the year 2036 to fight off the Observers.

Title: Terminator The Sarah Connor Chronicles
Description: A female Terminator from the year 2027 comes back in time to 1999 to protect a young John Connor. They then use the time displacement equipment to move forward in time by 8 years to hide John. Various other Terminators are sent back in time on varying missions.

Title: Dinosaur Train
Author: Craig Bartlett
Description: A T-rex named Buddy travels with his adopted Pteranodon family on the Dinosaur Train. The Dinosaur Train has the ability to visit the entire Mesozoic Era, the "Age of Dinosaurs", passing through magical Time Tunnels to meet the dinosaurs in the Triassic, Jurassic, and Cretaceous time periods.

Title: Paradox (TV series)
Author: Lizzie Mickery
Description: Detective Inspector Rebecca Flint (Tamzin Outhwaite), Detective Sergeant Ben Holt (Mark Bonnar) and Detective Constable Callum Gada (Chiké Okonkwo) investigate images being broadcast to an eminent astrophysicist Dr Christian King's (Emun Elliott) laboratory, which appear to show catastrophic events in the future.

Title: Being Erica
Author: Jana Sinyor
Description: Erica Strange begins seeing a counselor to deal with regrets in her life, only to discover the counselor (Michael Riley) has the ability to send her back in time to actually change these events.

Title: FlashForward
Author: Brannon Braga and David S. Goyer
Description: FBI agent Mark Benford and the rest of the world fall victim to an incident that renders the entire population of Earth unconscious for two minutes seventeen seconds on 6 October 2009. During the "Black Out", as it is called, the consciousness of everyone on the entire planet shifts forward six months into the future to the date 29 April 2010, where they witness their potential futures that could occur that day.

Title: Mary Shelley's Frankenhole
Author: Dino Stamotopolous
Description: Dr. Victor Frankenstein has since completely mastered immortality and now has also created an infinite number of Einstein-Rosen Bridge "wormholes" portals or "Frankenholes" between his small Eastern European village (which is teeming with monsters and supernatural forces) and every time period from the past and the future. This allows historical figures and celebrities seeking the doctor's services to find him. Although many classic horror monsters are present, the series' focus is mainly on Dr. Frankenstein and his family.

Title: Hoops & Yoyo Ruin Christmas
Description: In a TV special, Hoops and Yoyo accidentally travel through a wormhole and meet Santa Claus when he was still Kris Kringle.

Title: Puella Magi Madoka Magica
Author: Gen Urobuchi
Description: A mysterious girl named Homura Akemi is revealed to have made a contract with a being known as Kyubei to go back in time and save the titular character.

Title: Terra Nova
Description: When Earth is threatened with extinction in 2149, specially selected humans travel back 85 million years in hopes of preventing disaster later. However, they arrive on a parallel version of Earth (This avoids questions around creating a paradox when time-travelling).

Title: Primeval: New World
Description: A Canadian spin-off series to Primeval.

Title: Continuum (TV series)
Description: Canadian science fiction series centres on the conflict between a police officer and a group of rebels from the year 2077 who time-travel to Vancouver, BC in the year 2012.

Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Turtles in Time
Description: As the TMNT reach the Technodrome, Shredder sends the m through a time warp through the past (Age of Dinosaurs, a pirate ship in 1530 AD, a train in the American West in 1885 AD) and the future (New York City in 2020 AD and a Star Base in 2100 AD) before they can go back to their present in 1991.

Title: Maniac Mansion: Day of the Tentacle
Description: In order to prevent Purple Tentacle from growing a pair of arms and subsequently enslaving humanity, students Bernard, Laverne and Hoagie attempt to travel one day back in time in Dr. Edison's Chron-o-Johns, time machines housed in portable toilets. During the trip, the machines malfunction and strand Hoagie and Laverne 200 years into the past and future respectively. Players control each character in his/her own time zone (past, present, future), meeting historical figures and progenitors/descendants of some characters; the goal is to return Hoagie and Laverne to the present and prevent Purple Tentacle's world domination.

Title: Chrono Trigger
Description: A group of heroes from different eras travel back and forth through time in an attempt to prevent the end of the world in the year 1999.

Title: Crash Bandicoot: Warped
Description: Crash Bandicoot is sent to various points in time to retrieve relics.

Title: Vigilante 8: 2nd Offense
